metadata.title: CVE-2020-2929 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox product of Oracle Virtualization(component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are Prior to5.2.40, prior to 6.0.20 and prior to 6.1.6. Easily exploitablevulnerability allows low privileged attacker with logon to theinfrastructure where Oracle VM VirtualBox executes to compromise Oracle VMVirtualBox. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeoverof Oracle VM VirtualBox. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 7.8 (Confidentiality,Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2929` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-dkms - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-guest-utils - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-qt - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-source - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.18-dfsg-5').
